business.headline: Sensex jumps 750 points: 5 reasons why stock market is rising todayThe S&P BSE Sensex jumped 751.75 points to 85,338.76, while the NSE Nifty50 rose 237.25 points to 26,122.05 by 11:08 am.

How confusing investment tools with goals are costing youIt's easy to fall for traps with exciting returns, lifestyle upgrades, peer pressure or the "this stock is the next big thing" buzz. But life rarely hands you one challenge at a time. School fees, a home loan, a parent's health emergency or an unexpected crisis – they can all come together. Hence, relying on just one tool is like trying to build a house with no foundation – one storm and the whole thing collapses.

Explained: Why Bharti Airtel shares are down 3% todayBharti Airtel share price: Around 3.5 crore shares, equal to nearly 0.6% of Airtel's equity, were traded at Rs 2,108 apiece in the block deal window.

Sudeep Pharma IPO allotment today: Step-by-step status check and listing dateThe three-day subscription window, which closed on November 25, saw the IPO race towards nearly 100 times subscription, reflecting strong interest across investor categories.

Excelsoft Technologies IPO listing today: Will the stock open higher or lower?The allotment of shares was completed on November 24, and with the kind of subscription numbers the company has posted, many retail investors are hoping for a firm opening on the exchanges.

Tata Motors may hike prices early next quarterChandra said Tata Motors currently holds 16–17 per cent share in the SUV segment, and the Sierra is expected to lift this to 20–25 per cent once fully ramped up.

India's November Russian oil imports set to hit 5-month high amid US tariffsIndia, the world's third-largest oil importer, has been the biggest buyer of discounted seaborne Russian crude after Russia was shunned by Western countries following its 2022 invasion of Ukraine.
Sensex closes 314 points lower, Nifty below 26,000; Infosys down 1%The S&P BSE Sensex lost 313.70 points to close at 84,587.01, while the NSE Nifty50 was down by 74.70 points to end at 25,884.80.

Do new Labour Codes hit Narayana Murthy's 9-9-6 dreams?India's new Labour Codes cap workweeks at 48 hours, with flexibility on scheduling, overtime pay, and a mandatory day of rest. But as industry leaders like Narayana Murthy push for 72-hour weeks and L&T's SN Subrahmanyan praises 90-hour schedules, many are raising questions whether these reforms will hold ground in a culture where overwork is routine.

Waiting for your IPO to list? Here's how opening price on markets is decidedMost retail investors have little idea how the opening price for an IPO is decided. They often rely on grey market premium (GMP), hype, and subscription figures to guess the listing level, even though none of these factors directly set the price.

Do the new labour codes put full-time jobs at risk?Fixed-term jobs just got a major boost under the new labour codes. But does this new flexibility mean full-time roles are at risk, or will companies find a new balance altogether?

India–US trade deal looks quiet. The 'energy' shift tells another storyIndia and the US may look stalled on a formal trade deal, but shifting oil flows, a major LPG pact and calibrated tariff moves show the real progress is happening quietly behind the scenes.

Sudeep Pharma IPO closes today: Is it worth a bid? Check the GMPThe Rs 895-crore IPO includes a fresh issue of Rs 95 crore and an offer for sale worth Rs 800 crore. The price band is set at Rs 563 to Rs 593 per share, and the minimum investment for retail buyers is Rs 14,825.

GST 2.0 is lifting consumption. Can it lift Sensex and Nifty too?GST 2.0 has pushed prices down and demand up, but whether that momentum can lift Sensex and Nifty will depend on earnings, capex and global stability in the months ahead.

Tejas crash at Dubai Airshow isolated occurrence: Read HAL's full statementAn Indian Air Force Tejas fighter jet crashed in the United Arab Emirates on Friday while taking part in the Dubai Airshow 2025.

entertainment.headline: Thalapathy Vijay's Jana Nayagan trailer to be launched on December 31: Report Anticipation builds among fans as rumors circulate regarding the December release dates for the second single and trailer of Thalapathy Vijay's upcoming film 'Jana Nayagan', amidst the absence of official confirmation.

Meanwhile, the special screening of the classic film Sholay has been cancelled due to technical reasons.

Andrea Jeremiah on Pisasu 2: There are erotic scenes in the film, but no nudity Andrea Jeremiah has addressed questions regarding the presence of nude scenes in Mysskin's film 'Pisasu 2', explaining that while the script originally included such scenes, they were ultimately not filmed.

The Secret Lives of Mormon Wives renewed for 2 more seasons at Hulu Hulu has ordered 20 additional episodes of the reality series The Secret Lives of Mormon Wives, set to be split into Seasons 4 and 5, with the next season premiering in early 2026.

Mammootty's Kalamkaval to clash with Ranveer's Dhurandhar. New release date out The crime thriller Kalamkaval, starring Mammootty, announces a new theatrical release date following a postponement, as its recent trailer draws attention for its intense storytelling and powerful performances.

Sadie Sink shuts down marvel rumours: Hair colour can change, you know Sadie Sink discusses widespread rumours about her Marvel character following confirmation of her casting in Spider-Man: Brand New Day alongside Tom Holland and Zendaya.

Watch: Karan Aujla's Mumbai concert turns chaotic after Nigerian influencer brawl A physical altercation at Karan Aujla's November 23 concert in Mumbai's Loud Park, part of the Rolling Loud India festival, drew attention after Nigerian influencer Agu Stanley Chiedozie was involved in a heated fight with another attendee.

Rihanna cracks up at meme made from her unflattering photo on social media A meme featuring a candid photo of Rihanna from 2011 has prompted a direct response from the singer, leading to widespread discussion among fans on social media.

Amala Akkineni on her daughter-in-laws: Sobhita is independent, Zainab is warm Amala Akkineni opened up about her equation with her daughters-in-law Sobhita Dhulipala and Zainab Ravdjee, reflecting on the atmosphere of love, understanding, and religious diversity within the Akkineni family.

Jennifer Aniston styles her boyfriend Jim Curtis' hair, fans can't stop watching Jennifer Aniston shared a charming video on Instagram styling her boyfriend Jim Curtis's hair using her LolaVie products, delighting fans with this rare glimpse into their relationship. The couple recently made their first official public appearance, confirming their romance to the public.

Mahavatar Narsimha in race for Oscar shortlist in animated feature film category Mahavatar Narsimha, directed by Ashwin Kumar, is among 35 animated films eligible for consideration in the animated feature category at the 98th Academy Awards. The shortlist will be announced on December 16, as the film meets all required eligibility criteria for Oscar qualification.

How To Make A Killing trailer: Glen Powell plots for billions in dark comedy thriller A new trailer for the film How To Make A Killing, directed by John Patton Ford and starring Glen Powell, introduces audiences to a high-stakes story of inheritance, betrayal, and murder within a wealthy family.

Dhanush-Kriti Sanon's Tere Ishk Mein gets UA certificate, obscene word replaced The Central Board of Film Certification (CBFC) has cleared Aanand L Rai's 'Tere Ishk Mein' with a U/A 16+ certificate, requiring only a minor dialogue alteration, and confirmed its official runtime ahead of the film's global release.

Stranger Things 5: Season 4 ending explained and how it sets up Will's nightmare Stranger Things 5 is all set to release on Netflix, promising a thrilling conclusion to the intense battle that began in Season 4. The story delves deep into Vecna's sinister plans and Will Byers' pivotal role.

Netflix casts Toby Wallace as first lead in Assassin's Creed adaptation The Netflix adaptation of Assassin's Creed has cast Toby Wallace as its first series regular, marking the first major announcement for the live-action project.

Madelaine Petsch and Gavin Casalegno to star in Chasing Red film adaptation The upcoming film Chasing Red, starring Madelaine Petsch and Gavin Casalegno and based on the popular Wattpad webnovel, secures major international distribution ahead of release.

Wicked universe may grow bigger as Universal plans next steps Universal Pictures is considering expanding the Wicked franchise following the strong success of Wicked: For Good at the box office, with discussions underway for potential new film or television projects.

general news.headline: The 19 Bahadur: How CISF foiled Pakistan attack on Uri hydro plantOperation Sindoor: After India launched Operation Sindoor, Pakistan targeted the Uri hydroelectric power projects in Jammu and Kashmir. However, a CISF team of 19 foiled the Pakistani attack.

India went into Tea struggling at 90 for five and things worsened immediately after the break, with Sai Sudharsan falling early. Senuran Muthusamy struck in his very first over to give South Africa another boost. Washington Sundar has joined Ravindra Jadeja in the middle as India try to hang on and save the Test.

Put duties first for Viksit Bharat: PM's letter to citizens on Constitution Day"Every action of ours should strengthen the Constitution and further national goals and interests," PM Modi wrote in his letter to citizens on the occasion of India's 76th Constitution Day.

White House press secretary Karoline Leavitt's family member detained by ICEBruna Caroline Ferreira, the mother of Karoline Leavitt's 11-year-old nephew, was detained by ICE agents earlier this month. Officials said her visa expired in June 1999.

Trump Jr's India diary: Taj, temples, tigers and big Bollywood weddingDonald Trump Jr embarked on a dynamic week-long tour across India, engaging in heritage, conservation and high-profile events. His visit sparked social media buzz and hints at future business ties with Indian industrialists.

IMD said the system will cross the Indonesia coast before weakening. A separate well-marked low is strengthening over the southwest Bay of Bengal.

Why Bihar is taking back Patna's 10 Circular Road from Lalu Yadav's familyThe Bihar government has reclaimed the iconic 10 Circular Road bungalow from the Lalu Prasad family after nearly two decades, marking a significant shift in the state's political landscape. This move reflects the strengthened position of the BJP and changing power dynamics in Bihar.

Teen dies in freak accident as basketball pole crushes him, tragedy on cameraThe incident occurred around 10 am at the sports ground in Haryana's Rohtak when the player was practising alone on the basketball court. The accident was captured on CCTV.

Sheikh Hasina's death sentence and politics of patienceThe death sentence awarded to Sheikh Hasina isn't a reason for the Awami League's political trajectory to change. The 76-year-old party remains remarkably steady and composed. By contrast, those who defeated the Awami League and came to power through an engineered process appear far more restless than necessary.

Pitbull attacks boy, bites off ear. This is exactly who should be punishedA neighbour's pitbull mauled a six-year-old boy grievously, detaching his ear, in Delhi. The pitbull is on the list of 24 dogs that the Centre had in March 2024 banned as pets. The ban has been stayed by the Karnataka High Court. But is banning breeds the answer to stopping attacks by pet dogs? Ultimately, who should be held responsible, and punished?

Live: Rain in southern India as low pressure area over Bay of Bengal may intensifyCyclone Senyar Live Updates: Cyclonic Storm Senyar formed over the Strait of Malacca after a deep depression intensified early Wednesday. The Indian Meteorological Department said the system will cross the Indonesia coast before weakening. A separate well-marked low is strengthening over the southwest Bay of Bengal. The weather department has predicted heavy rainfall over Tamil Nadu from November 25 to 30, Kerala and Mahe on November 25 and 26, Coastal Andhra Pradesh, Yanam, and Rayalaseema from November 29 to December 1, and the Andaman and Nicobar Islands from November 25 to 29. Fake degrees, political pressure: US diplomat exposes fraud in H-1B visa programmeIndian-American diplomat Mahvash Siddiqui has alleged rampant fraud in the H-1B visa system, claiming 80–90% of applications from India were fake. She says that during her tenure at the US Consulate in Chennai (2005–2007), officials repeatedly flagged the issue to Washington, but political pressure prevented any action.

sports.headline: Gandharbal's Glory: Teen Inspires After Completing Athletic Meet Post 15 Surgeries A 15-year-old specially-abled girl from Gandharbal has created history by completing a 400-meter track event at a recent athlete meet. This achievement is notable as it came after the teenager underwent multiple surgeries on her knees and legs. The report highlights that despite physical challenges, she participated and finished the race, bringing glory to the Gandharbal district. Her determination was recognized and she was felicitated by the Indian Army for her accomplishment. The story focuses on her journey and the significance of her participation in the athletic competition, positioning her as an inspirational figure for the region. The report from Srinagar covers the details of her story and the impact of her historic run at the Gandharbal athlete meet.

Watch: Virat Kohli welcomed by ex-RCB teammate at Ranchi airport before SA ODIs India vs South Africa: Virat Kohli arrived in Ranchi on Wednesday for the ODI series opener, which will be played in the city on November 30. The former captain was welcomed by Saurabh Tiwary, his former RCB teammate and the secretary of the JSCA.

PSL turmoil: Multan Sultans owner quits amid rift with Pakistan Cricket Board PSL: Ali Khan Tareen has confirmed his departure as Multan Sultans owner following the PCB's decision not to offer a renewal. The move comes amid ongoing tensions, legal notices, and public criticism, leaving the franchise's future uncertain.

Caught on CCTV: National-level player dies after basketball hoop falls on him This report covers the death of 16-year-old national-level basketball player, Hardik, in a tragic accident in Lakhan Majra, Rohtak. The incident occurred when a basketball pole crashed down on him while he was practicing alone on the court. The event, captured on CCTV, has raised serious questions about the quality and safety of sports infrastructure in the state. According to India Today's Aman Bharadwaj, 'people and sportsmen do question that how come the preparations being made, the infrastructure is being established, that the pole or the things in the basketball court, they are taking lives.' This is reportedly the second such incident in Haryana in a week, following a similar death in Bahadurgarh.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
